<title level="1" pfs="">[Crawling Slurry](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1796)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Acid damage can scar stone and reduce flesh to pitted chunks, but some organic compounds are resistant to acid and respond by combining into a mass of roiling, living slurry. These scarred clumps hunger to consume anything they can sense. They move with quick, darting contractions that surprise those used to facing slow-moving oozes.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Ooze](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 40

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Ooze_CrawlingSlurry.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 16">[Crawling Slurry](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1796)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=3" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
<trait label="Ooze" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=122" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #174: Shadows of the Ancients](/Sources.aspx?ID=115) pg. 82</row>

**Perception** +26; motion sense 60 feet, no vision

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +35, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +30

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +5

**Dex** +9

**Con** +6

**Int** -5

**Wis** +0

**Cha** -5
</row>

**Motion Sense** A crawling slurry can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +28 

**Ref** +31 

**Will** +20 

</row>

**HP** 300

**Immunities**
[acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), critical hits, [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38), [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)

**Splatter** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The crawling slurry takes bludgeoning damage from a creature it can sense within 10 feet; **Effect** The crawling slurry ejects a splash of acid onto the creature, dealing acid damage equal to the bludgeoning damage dealt to the crawling slurry (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, climb 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
pseudopod +32,
**Damage** 3d10+11 bludgeoning plus 2d8 acid and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** <actions string="Single Action" />  2d10+3 bludgeoning plus 2d8 acid, DC 37

**Crawling Slurry Acid**   A crawling slurry's acid damages metals and organic materials but not stone.

**[Engulf](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=14)** <actions string="Two Actions" />  DC 37, 5d10 acid, [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC 37, Rupture 20. A crawling slurry regains 30 Hit Points if a living creature it is engulfing dies.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Accidental Oozes</title>

Crawling slurries are almost always by-products of toxic waste or alchemical runoff into areas with a high concentration of acid, magic, or both. The first quickening pulses of animation in acid-pitted flesh are easy enough to end with counteracting chemicals or even isolation and starvation, but most crawling slurries are left to fester for a long time and become as large as a person. Left untended in a vat of nutritive acids and organic matter, a crawling slurry might become truly immense, but the power such a slithering horror holds is beyond comprehension.
</aside>
